title: I found the love of my life in a prison on the other side of the world
description: Jessica Silvey, 30, from Brisbane married her husband Craig, 34, while he was serving a 10-year prison sentence in Kansas for attempted aggravated robbery in the US.
content:
An Australian woman who fell for an American prisoner after connecting online has revealed the dramatic twists her life has taken amid their unconventional relationship.

Jessica Silvey, 30, from Brisbane married Craig Silvey, 34, while he was serving a 10-year prison sentence in Kansas for attempted aggravated robbery.

The pair met through a prison pen-pals program and later starred in the hit reality show Prison Brides which followed seven women from around the world who married convicted criminals in America.

But despite packing up her life in Australia in 2023 and bidding farewell to her worried family to be with her husband, Jessica now admits it was all a mistake.

'Ah man, I wish I never did it,' she said on social media.

The couple tied the knot halfway through Craig's sentence in a prison ceremony and had been husband and wife for five years before he was granted early release in 2023.

Craig admits his rap sheet was long, and that he had only been a free man for around three years since he was 12 years old.

During his most recent sentence, he spent most of his time in a correctional centre before being placed on a work release program.

'It's a facility they allow you to go and reintegrate yourself to society where you can go to work and have a job, to make money,' he said on the show.

'So I got a job as a welder and I have saved about $35,000 - that's a huge accomplishment. I have never even held $2,000 in my hand before.'

Cameras then followed Jessica as she flew across the world to start a new life with the man she had only known in a prison setting.

'She is moving away from everyone she has ever known for someone she has only met once, that is in prison,' her concerned friend said.

Jessica, an insurance broker, was giddy with excitement as she stood at the prison gates ready to start her new life - but the fairytale romance was over within months.

Viewers saw awkward moments as the pair adjusted to life outside prison walls with Craig struggling to adapt while his wife was eager to start a family.

Just weeks after his release, Jessica became pregnant and while the news was met with excitement on the show, behind the scenes, tensions were building.

'Money is one of our biggest points of contention,' Jessica admitted to the camera as more and more packages of baby gear arrived.

Jessica claimed Craig had no idea of the sacrifices she had made, but he was concerned by his prison wages dwindling away.

'You just can't take any accountability,' he replied.

'Seven years saving and I spent the majority of it on this relationship.'

By early 2024, rumours swirled that the marriage was in trouble and Craig was arrested for domestic violence charges.

Jessica ended up moving back to Australia to have her baby saying at the time, 'We both underestimated how difficult it was going to be coming out of doing 10 years in prison.'

After giving birth to their son, Hudson, Jessica had a change of heart and moved back to the US in November 2024.

'This time coming back to the States has been a really tough adjustment for me,' she said in an Instagram post.

'Craig has stepped up and taken on so much over the last week.

'He has been absolutely amazing with Hudson and is a complete natural with him.'

She went on to thank him for being patient with her.

Fans of the show have now speculated that the apparent rekindling of their relationship may mean the pair will appear in a second season of Prison Brides.

The couple have further fuelled the rumour by locking down all of their social media accounts in recent months.

But it seems the rocky relationship is still over, with Jessica commenting on social media posts about the show just a week ago, saying she wished she had never married Craig.
summary: Australian woman Jessica Silvey, 30, married American prisoner Craig Silvey while he was serving a 10-year prison sentence in Kansas for attempted aggravated robbery. The pair met through a prison pen-pals program and later starred in the reality show Prison Brides, which followed seven women worldwide who married convicted criminals in America. Despite her initial excitement and excitement about starting a new life with Craig, Jessica now admits it was a mistake and expresses regret over her decision to marry him. The couple had been married for five years before Craig was granted early release in 2023. After giving birth to their son, Hudson, Jessica moved back to the US in November 2024. The apparent rekindling of their relationship may lead to a second season of Prison Bride.
shortSummary: Australian Jessica Silvey, 30, married convicted robber Craig Silvey in Kansas, but ended up in Australia for her baby's sake.

Pregnant Jessica Cunningham cradles her blossoming baby bump as she steps out at birthday party... after father of her children's tragic death last year
She revealed her longed-for pregnancy at the end of 2017, following a traumatic few months when her ex committed suicide and she suffered a miscarriage.
And Jessica Cunningham looked truly radiant as she showcased her blossoming bump at the Akea 1st Birthday Party at the Bentley Garage in Knutsford, Cheshire on Thursday.
The former Apprentice star, 30, was inch the glowing mother to be as she sweetly cradled her blooming stomach while shooting the camera a radiant smile.
Glowing: Jessica Cunningham looked truly radiant as she showcased her blossoming bump at the Akea 1st Birthday Party at the Bentley Garage in Knutsford, Cheshire on Thursday
Mother of three: She revealed her longed-for pregnancy at the end of 2017, following a traumatic few months when her ex committed suicide and she suffered a miscarriage
She showcased her baby bump in a tight-fitting black sweater, while showing off her toned legs in PVC leggings.
Adding height and a pop of colour to her ensemble, she slipped on a pair of blush pink stack heels.
Her brunette tresses were styled into cute French braids while her radiant complexion was enhanced with fluttery lashes, highlighter and a sweep of rose lipstick.
Jessica is expecting her first child with boyfriend Alex Daw, after they suffered a miscarriage in October.
Bumping along: The former Apprentice star, 30, was inch the glowing mother to be as she sweetly cradled her blooming stomach while shooting the camera a radiant smile
Second trimester: She showcased her baby bump in a tight-fitting black sweater, while showing off her toned legs in PVC leggings
She has revealed that she is expecting her baby on June 28, which is also the date of her partner, Alex's birthday.
Jessica already has three daughters with ex-boyfriend Alistair Eccles, who took his own life in August 2017 aged 35.
Talking on Lorraine earlier this month, she admitted how devastating it had been to tell her girls of their father's tragic passing.
She said: I've never been through it, so I didn’t know how to tell them, it was one of the hardest things we've had to do.
'Never do you imagine you’d have to go through it, but luckily they are amazing children and they're so happy, they have really good support around them.'
Mum to be: Adding height and a pop of colour to her ensemble, she slipped on a pair of blush pink stack heels
Night out: Her brunette tresses were styled into cute French braids while her radiant complexion was enhanced with fluttery lashes, highlighter and a sweep of rose lipstick
She said: 'My partner and myself were very open with what questions they do ask us because we want them to want to talk to us and trust us.
'They are coping really well. I think it's really important, when the news broke about my ex-partner, the amount of women who got in touch in a similar situation, a lot of people get forgotten about.
'When you are going through a bad part of your life, you're comforted by knowing other people have gone through it.
'I write a blog, I love it, it's very cathartic and hopefully it helps me to inspire other people.'
Heartbreaking: Jessica already has three daughters with ex-boyfriend Alistair Eccles, who took his own life in August 2017 aged 35
Talking about looking forward to the future and her excitement over adding to her brood, Jessica, who also starred in Celebrity Big Brother in 2016, said:
'I'm a big believer in the power of the universe. When we got pregnant the first time round, I thought this is incredible.
'I started to get excited and then we had the miscarriage. It was really sad, but you just get on with it. We had to.
And gushing over Alex, she said: 'He's such a lovely person and I feel very lucky to have him this pregnancy has come at the right time.
Family first: Jessica is expecting her first child with boyfriend Alex Daw, after they suffered a miscarriage in October
'You can't enjoy it the same after a miscarriage, because you worry about it constantly... but touch wood everything seems to be going OK.
'Everybody goes through stuff in life; ups and downs. You just have to find the positives out of every negative.
'You can wallow in self-pity but that drags you under, or be positive and look to the future. That’s got me through last year... that, and the children.'
Devoted mother: Jessica said her children had got her through a traumatic 2017

argos_summary: Jessica Silvey, a 30‑year‑old Brisbane insurance broker, married 34‑year‑old Craig Silvey while he was serving a 10‑year Kansas prison sentence, and the couple starred in the reality show "Prison Brides." After moving to the US, the marriage quickly unraveled amid financial strain, a pregnancy, and domestic‑violence charges, leading Jessica to return to Australia to give birth to their son Hudson. She later moved back to the US, but the relationship remains strained, and she has publicly expressed regret over the marriage. Speculation about a second season of the show has surfaced, but the couple’s future together is uncertain.
